channel.title: 508 works for vista?
channel.description:
Well im really mad at my computer because the new 508 sources aren't working for my computer here's the pic showing what's wrong... [IMG]http://i343.photobucket.com/albums/o457/google_googleisme/508.jpg[/img] Images edited and not edited to be fake please see all the images above here I have download 3, 508 sources and they did the same thing
(I have java 6_2)

item.title: 508 works for vista?
item.dc:creator: @eddieriosjr eddieriosjr
item.description:
@eddieriosjr wrote:

Already did sorry doesn’t work I have to find out the

What you have to do is go into Start > (Right Click) Computer > Properties (Advanced Tab) Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open. Rename it to “PATH” and then for it’s variable value (erase old one):
C:\Windows\System32;
And add this[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 18, 2008, 03:02:12 pm[/size][hr]Someone please post already -.-[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 19, 2008, 09:58:02 am[/size][hr]Please lock this report this post -.- I found the problem

Read full topic

item.title: 508 works for vista?
item.dc:creator: @eddieriosjr eddieriosjr
item.description:
@eddieriosjr wrote:

Exiled-Isle:

Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open.

no “path” on vista sorry and don’t vote noob if you don’t have vista only help if you have Vista Home Edition

Read full topic

item.title: 508 works for vista?
item.dc:creator: @Exiled-Isle Exiled-Isle
item.description:
@Exiled-Isle wrote:

What you have to do is go into Start > (Right Click) Computer > Properties (Advanced Tab) Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open. Rename it to “PATH” and then for it’s variable value (erase old one):
C:\Windows\System32;
And add this

"C:Program FilesJavajdkx.x.x_xxbin"

Change the x’s to your version of java

You will also need to set a variables called “classpath”. Make a new variable and give it the name classpath. Now add this in for it’s value:

"C:Program FilesJavajdkx.x.x_xxbin"

Read full topic

item.title: 508 works for vista?
item.dc:creator: @eddieriosjr eddieriosjr
item.description:
@eddieriosjr wrote:

[quote=“k1ngy, post:8, topic:236760”][quote author=eddieriosjr link=topic=312517.msg2490933#msg2490933 date=1224110991]

go to my computer…right click on it
[/quote] Vista doesn’t have My computer, only Computer and doesn’t do anything

yea it does, and computer is the exact same " they just removed the “my”" and maybe your java is located in x86?

try downloading java if you cant find it

to try and find go to
computer–>c:–>program files–>java.
(maybe another drive but c is standard)
check if there is a jdk1.6_0.0X
rename it in the .txt to the correct version
and if you dont see anything jdk named, download it from java.sun.com

hope this helps

and trust me im on a vista 64bit, im not stupid.[/quote]
jdk1.5.0_16[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 16, 2008, 09:12:07 pm[/size][hr][quote=“greendrag131, post:10, topic:236760”]no u have to put in were the 7 is and put 3[/quote]WTF that mean?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 16, 2008, 09:14:22 pm[/size][hr]If you want to help me someone get team viewer then help me on this k?

item.title: 508 works for vista?
item.dc:creator: @SkillersDream SkillersDream
item.description:
@SkillersDream wrote:

I Have Vista. Go Into Computer OS(C:) Now Click on Program Files, then Java And It will Show Your Jdk, Then Replace All the Jdk1.6.0_07 With Your Jdk, You’ve got to do it to everything in cmds folder.

Read full topic

item.title: 508 works for vista?
item.dc:creator: @k1ngy k1ngy
item.description:
@k1ngy wrote:

[quote=“eddieriosjr, post:6, topic:236760”][quote author=Rs2-Devolution link=topic=312517.msg2490112#msg2490112 date=1224049981]
go to my computer…right click on it
[/quote] Vista doesn’t have My computer, only Computer and doesn’t do anything :P[/quote]

yea it does, and computer is the exact same " they just removed the “my”" and maybe your java is located in x86?

try downloading java if you cant find it

to try and find go to
computer–>c:–>program files–>java.
(maybe another drive but c is standard)
check if there is a jdk1.6_0.0X
rename it in the .txt to the correct version
and if you dont see anything jdk named, download it from java.sun.com

hope this helps

and trust me im on a vista 64bit, im not stupid.

Read full topic
